explanation: New Delhi, National Capital of India.It is situated in the North-Central part of the country on the West bank of the Yamuna River, adjacent to and just south of Delhi City.
There are 28 states and 8 Union territories in the Country.
Mumbai is the Economic hub and financial centre of India.
The magnificent Tiger, Panther tigris is a striped animal, the combination of grace, strength, agility and enormous power has earned the Tiger its pride of place as the National animal of India.

question: Which is the most populous State in India?
explanation: Uttar pradesh with a population of more than 166 million holds distinction of being the most populous state in the country followed by Maharashtra(97 million) and Bihar(83 million).
